abstract: Wal-Mart says it will cut 20 million metric tons of greenhouse gas emissions from its supply chain by 2015.
snippet: Wal-Mart says it will cut 20 million metric tons of greenhouse gas emissions from its supply chain by 2015.
lead_paragraph: Wal-Mart, the nation’s largest retailer, announced on Thursday that it would cut some 20 million metric tons of greenhouse gas emissions from its supply chain by the end of 2015  the equivalent of removing more than 3.8 million cars from the road for a year.

headline.main: Wal-Mart Unveils Plan to Make Supply Chain Greener
headline.print_headline: Wal-Mart Plans to Make Its Supply Chain Greener

abstract: The company’s carbon-reduction effort focuses on its supply chain. Is it an effective model?
snippet: The company’s carbon-reduction effort focuses on its supply chain. Is it an effective model?
lead_paragraph: Wal-Mart has announced an initiative that aims to achieve major reductions in greenhouse-gas emissions from its supply chain. As Stephanie Rosenbloom reports for The New York Times, the company said it would cut 20 million metric tons of emissions by the end of 2015 by focusing on popular product categories with the highest embedded carbon — milk, bread, meat, clothing. It said it would lean on its suppliers to rethink the sources, manufacturing processes, packaging and transportation of their goods.
